choices.D: This is a hub that has received a query from a spoke and has forwarded it to another spoke.
choices.C: Two spokes, 100.64.3.1 and 10.1.2.254, forward their queries to their hubs.
choices.B: Two hubs, 10.1.1.254 and 10.1.2.254, are receiving and forwarding queries between each other.
choices.A: This is a spoke that has received a query from a remote hub and has forwarded the response to its hub.

questions.question_text: Which two statements describe how IPsec phase 1 main mode id different from aggressive mode when performing IKE negotiation? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Sorry, my bad. The 'all-rules' rule is not the name of the implicit rule, so it has to be B&C.
Answer is A&C. These are correct statements. Can't be B because other than the default SDWAN rule, there is only 1 other SDWAN rule configured. The default rule can't be considered a configured rule.

Selected Answer: BC
Ans is BC
page 41, Fortigate check regular policy first

choices.A: The all_rules rule represents the implicit SD-WAN rule.
choices.C: Entry 1 (id=1) is a regular policy route.
